pages.title: What Chicken3PO does
pages.content:
This bot allows you to easily organize your coops for EggInc contracts.
When a new contract comes out, admins and Coop Organizers can create a reserved area for it, where players will register their in-game coops and others can join.
You will also be able to follow who has still to join and who has already done a leggacy contract.

pages.title: /register-alt [member] [name-main] [name-alt]
pages.content:
- Registers an alt EggInc account for the Discord account
- *member* = The Discord account
- *name-main* = The EggInc name of the main account
- *name-alt* = The EggInc name of the alt account

pages.title: /unregister-alt [member]
pages.content:
- Unregisters the alt EggInc account for the Discord account
- *member* = The Discord account

pages.title: /settings [setting] [value]
pages.content:
- Changes a setting value of the bot for the guild
- *setting* = The setting to change
- *value* = The value to set

pages.title: /contract [contract-id] [size] [is-leggacy]
pages.content:
- Admins and coop organizers only
- Registers a new contract and creates a channel and category for it
- *contract-id* = The unique ID for an EggInc contract
- *size* = Number of slots available in the contract
- *is-leggacy* = Whether the contract is leggacy or not

pages.title: Already done button
pages.content:
If the contract is a leggacy and you have already completed it in one of its previous appearances, you can click this button to tell the organizers you won't be participating in it
If you use it by accident (despite the confirmation check), you can use it a second time to get back in the remaining list and join coops

pages.title: /codes
pages.content:
- **Use in a contract channel**
- Admins and coop organizers only
- Sends a list of the coop codes for the contract

pages.title: Remove contract with context menu
pages.content:
- Admins and coop organizers only
Once all coops are completed/failed, you can delete the contract's category by right-clicking on the contract message and select `Apps` -> `Remove contract`

pages.title: /contract-remove
pages.content:
- **Use in a contract channel**
- Admins and coop organizers only
- Slash command alternative for the `Remove contract` context menu, as they are not supported on mobile

pages.title: /coop [coop-code] [locked]
pages.content:
- **Use in a contract channel**
- Registers a new coop and displays it in the contract channel
- *coop-code* = The code to join the coop
- *locked* = Whether or not the coop is locked at creation. Prevents people from joining

pages.title: Join button
pages.content:
To join an open coop, click on the join button below the list of the coop members.
You will be given the code to join in-game and access to your coop's reserved channel

pages.title: /lock
pages.content:
- **Use in a coop channel**
- Admins, coop organizers and coop creators only
- Locks a coop, preventing people from joining

pages.title: /unlock
pages.content:
- **Use in a coop channel**
- Admins, coop organizers and coop creators only
- Unlocks a coop, allowing people to join again

pages.title: /kick [member]
pages.content:
- **Use in a coop channel**
- Admins, coop organizers and coop creators only
- Kicks someone from a coop
- *member* = The member to be kicked from the coop

pages.title: Coop completed with context menu
pages.content: Once your coop is completed, you can mark it as so by right-clicking on your coop message and select `Apps` -> `Coop completed`

pages.title: /coop-completed
pages.content:
- **Use in a coop channel**
- Admins, coop organizers and coop creators only
- Slash command alternative for the `Coop completed` context menu, as they are not supported on mobile

pages.title: Coop failed with context menu
pages.content:
If you happen to fail your coop, you can mark it as so by right-clicking on your coop message and select `Apps` -> `Coop failed`
This will return all members to the remaining list so they can join or create another coop

pages.title: /coop-failed
pages.content:
- **Use in a coop channel**
- Admins, coop organizers and coop creators only
- Slash command alternative for the `Coop failed` context menu, as they are not supported on mobile
